user.name: Prem Banker
user.bio: Hi, I am Prem Banker, currently pursuing my Masters in Computer Science at Virginia Tech. I moved to the states in Fall of 23 before which I was in India where I did my Bachelors and work.

education.title: masters
education.description: I joined Virginia Tech in the Fall of 23, Throughout the semester, I have taken numerous courses including but not limited to Modelling and Evaluation, Information Visualization, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning 1, Web Development I joined Virginia Tech in the Fall of 23, Throughout the semester, I have taken numerous courses including but not limited to Modelling and Evaluation, Information Visualization, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning 1, Web Development I joined Virginia Tech in the Fall of 23, Throughout the semester, I have taken numerous courses including but not limited to Modelling and Evaluation, Information Visualization, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning 1, Web Development I joined Virginia Tech in the Fall of 23, Throughout the semester, I have taken numerous courses including but not limited to Modelling and Evaluation, Information Visualization, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning 1, Web Development I joined Virginia Tech in the Fall of 23, Throughout the semester, I have taken numerous courses including but not limited to Modelling and Evaluation, Information Visualization, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning 1, Web Development I joined Virginia Tech in the Fall of 23, Throughout the semester, I have taken numerous courses including but not limited to Modelling and Evaluation, Information Visualization, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning 1, Web Development

work.title: Full Stack Dev
work.description: Have been working on certain things mayn, worked there for about 2.5 years, I built meet, pwa rtc etc. greatest team member of all time

projects.name: Pro-folio
projects.description: Portfolio for pros. This is a portfolio website for software developers. The code is open sourced, enabling anyone to make quick meta data changes and load up their own portfolio website.

projects.name: CarbonKarma
projects.description: CarbonKarma is a decentralized finance (DeFi) application built on the Ripple XRPL blockchain that rewards users with our cryptocurrency called CRBT (CarbonReward Token) for choosing sustainable modes of transportation. The platform leverages Google's travel data and the Carbon Interface API to calculate the carbon emissions associated with different travel options and then converts the emission amount into the CRBT tokens.

projects.name: Marubot
projects.description: MaruBot is an intelligent chatbot for Discord and a web extension, utilizing advanced AI to provide context-aware, personalized responses. It retrieves information from chat history and documents using a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) model, enhancing search efficiency and automating tasks with robust privacy protections.

projects.name: Meet - Quicko
projects.description: MEET is an online tax advisory platform where customers can come and book meetings with Tax experts to solve their income tax related problems. This was developed during my time at Quicko using Flutter, node.js and aws.

projects.name: Tax filing on Mobile - Quicko
projects.description: This is a mobile webapp for filing and paying income taxes in India. This was built by me while at Quicko using Flutter on the frontend and node.js and Java on the backend

projects.name: Clique - Quicko
projects.description: Clique is the affiliate program for Quicko where users can manage their conversions, transactions and settlement reports of the people they have referred

projects.name: Kahaniyan
projects.description: Kahaniyan is an online bookstore which was made as a recurrent project exercise in CS5244 Web Technologies at VT. The bookstore was designed using Figma and coded out in React and Java

projects.name: Soccer Events Analytics
projects.description: This project analyzes soccer game events like goals, assists, shots, blocks, and clearances. Based on this data, it provides various insights into players, their playstyles, and team strategies. The analysis helps determine key patterns and trends in player and team performance.

projects.name: Voice-Guided Identity Verification
projects.description: This project develops a cost-effective voice recognition solution for identity verification, targeting virtual settings like online education and meetings. It uses audio data converted into log mel spectrograms and classifies them with a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) for reliable and secure identification and attendance tracking.

projects.name: Instagram Bot Comment detector
projects.description: This Instagram bot comment remover identifies and reports bot comments, hiding them from the user's view to clean up the comments section. It uses a machine learning model and Selenium automator to scan and analyze comments. The ML classifier is trained on thousands of labeled data points using NLP techniques.

projects.name: Visual Occupancy Detection System
projects.description: VODS for smart parking lot management differentiates between empty and occupied parking spaces. Utilizing a CNN model trained on over 120k images, it identifies available spots for drivers. As traffic congestion increases, this low-cost system offers significant benefits in time savings and pollution reduction.

projects.name: Balley
projects.description: Balley is a 2D hypercasual infinite-runner type game made using Unity. The goal is to stay alive for as long as possible, gain points by bouncing off the raised platforms and to collect coins and power-ups while you're at it. The game gets progressively difficult as the points increase & also features an in-game store from where players can buy skins and powerups.
